name: dokku
description: Dokku is a small PaaS built on Docker that lets you deploy apps using git push. It supports buildpacks, environment config, plugins, and multiple languages, providing a Heroku-like workflow on your own server with minimal overhead.
features: Git push deployment: Deploy applications by pushing code to a Git remote without manual build steps or configuration.
Buildpack support: Automatically detect and build Node.js, Python, Ruby, PHP, and other languages using Heroku buildpacks.
Zero-downtime deploys: Roll out new versions with automatic health checks and traffic switching for uninterrupted service.
Plugin system: Extend functionality with community plugins for databases, caching, monitoring, and additional services.
SSL automation: Obtain and renew Let's Encrypt certificates automatically for secure HTTPS connections.
Environment management: Configure application settings using environment variables without modifying code.
Database linking: Provision and connect PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, and other databases with single commands.
Domain routing: Map custom domains to applications with automatic proxy configuration and virtual host management.
